intro: Empogona kirkii subsp. kirkii, commonly known as the African black beer plant, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, oval leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are often used in traditional brewing practices. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and partial shade. Due to its unique properties, it has attracted interest for both its cultural and potential medicinal uses.
